titles.title: Prayer Is The Soul's Sincere Desire (easy nice

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Prayer is the soul's sincere desire Uttered or unexpressed The motion of a hidden fire That trembles in the breast{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Prayer is the burden of a sigh The falling of a tear The upward glancing of an eye When none but God is near{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Prayer is the simplest form of speech That infant lips can try Prayer the sublimest strains that reach The Majesty on high{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Prayer is the Christian's vital breath The Christian's native air His watchword at the gates of death He enters rest with prayer{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}The Saints in prayer appear as one In word and deed and mind While with the Father and the Son Sweet fellowship they find{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: {lang-eng}O Thou by whom we come to God The Life the Truth the Way The path of prayer Thyself hast trod Lord teach us how to pray{/lang-eng}
